intro: Belvala spicata, commonly known as the spike bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically in shades of blue or purple. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, often found in grassy meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Belvala spicata is valued in gardens for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
